declarations.comments: A Rose, or multi-way tree, with values of type `a`.
declarations.title: Tree

declarations.comments: Create a `Tree` from a `Node` value of type `a` and a `Forest` of children.
declarations.title: mkTree

declarations.comments: Draw a 2D `String` representation of a `Tree String`.
declarations.title: drawTree

declarations.comments:
Draw a 2D `String`  representation of a `Tree` composed of `Show`able
elements.
declarations.title: showTree

declarations.comments:
Scan a `Tree`, accumulating values of `b` there are constant across `Node`s
that have the same parent.
declarations.title: scanTree

declarations.comments:
Scan a `Tree`, accumulating values of `b` there are constant across `Node`s
that have the same parent, and returning a `Tree` of type `c`.
declarations.title: scanTreeAccum

declarations.comments: Set the value of a node.
declarations.title: setNodeValue

declarations.comments: Modify the value of a node.
declarations.title: modifyNodeValue

declarations.comments: Append a child to a node.
declarations.title: appendChild

declarations.comments:
The `Loc` type describes the location of a `Node` inside a `Tree`. For this
we store the current `Node`, the sibling nodes that appear before the current
node, the sibling nodes that appear after the current node, and a `Array` of
`Loc`ations that store the parent node locations up to the root of the three.

So, effectively, the `parents` field records the path travelled in the
tree to reach the level of the current `Node` starting from the tree's root,
and the `before` and `after` fields describe its location in the current
level.
declarations.title: Loc

declarations.comments: Move the cursor to the next sibling.
declarations.title: next

declarations.comments: Move the cursor to the root of the tree.
declarations.title: root

declarations.comments: Move the cursor to the first child of the current `Node`.
declarations.title: firstChild

declarations.comments: Move the cursor to the first child of the current `Node`.
declarations.title: down

declarations.comments: Move the cursor to the last child of the current `Node`.
declarations.title: lastChild

declarations.comments: Move the cursor to a specific sibling by it's index.
declarations.title: siblingAt

declarations.comments: Move the cursor to a specific child of the current `Node` by it's index.
declarations.title: childAt

declarations.comments:
Retrieve the `Tree` representation, i.e., returns the root `Node` of the
current tree.
declarations.title: toTree

declarations.comments: Get a `Loc`ation representation from a given `Tree`.
declarations.title: fromTree

declarations.comments: Set the `Node` at the current position.
declarations.title: setNode

declarations.comments: Set the `Node` at the current position.
declarations.title: modifyNode

declarations.comments: Set the value of the current `Node`.
declarations.title: setValue

declarations.comments: Modify the value of the current `Node`.
declarations.title: modifyValue

declarations.comments: Insert a node after the current position, and move cursor to the new node.
declarations.title: insertAfter

declarations.comments: Insert a node before the current position, and move cursor to the new node.
declarations.title: insertBefore

declarations.comments: Insert a node as a child to  the current node, and move cursor to the new node.
declarations.title: insertChild

declarations.comments: Delete the node in the current position.
declarations.title: delete

declarations.comments: Search down and to the right for the first occurence where the given predicate is true and return the Loc
declarations.title: findDownWhere

declarations.comments: Search for the first occurence of the value `a` downwards and to the right.
declarations.title: findDown

declarations.comments: Search to the left and up for the first occurence where the given predicate is true and return the Loc
declarations.title: findUpWhere

declarations.comments: Search for the first occurence of the value `a` upwards and to the left,
declarations.title: findUp

declarations.comments: Search from the root of the mkTree for the first occurrence where the given predicate is truen and return the Loc
declarations.title: findFromRootWhere

declarations.comments:
Search for the first occurence of the value `a` starting from the root of
the tree.
declarations.title: findFromRoot

declarations.comments: flattens the Tree into a Array depth first.
declarations.title: flattenLocDepthFirst
